basic.description: This is a second course on the basic concepts and applications of signals and systems analysis. Discrete time signals and systems are emphasized. Topics include: sampling and reconstruction; discrete-time signals and systems; difference equations; Z-transform and solutions to difference equations; discrete Fourier series and discrete time Fourier transform; filtering concepts; applications to pulse amplitude modulation, delta modulation, and speech coding.
basic.subject: ELEC
basic.title: Discrete-Time Signals and Systems

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite of ELEC323 and registered in a BSCE Academic Program.
